item.title: Tweet Button parameter reference
item.description: A Tweet Button supports prepopulating share text, hashtags, and a Twitter account reference. Associate related Twitter accounts to drive followers. Tweet content parameters in_reply_to optional Status ID string of a parent Tweet such as a Tweet from your account (if applicable). Example...

item.title: Twitter | MoPub Server-to-Server API Technical Specifications 1.0
item.description: Overview The MoPub Server-to-Server API makes it easier for ad networks and demand partners to connect with the MoPub platform outside of SDK libraries. To integrate with MoPub through the Server-to-Server API, follow the integration approval process and technical specifications...

item.title: Generating Ad Unit Code for Integration
item.description: From the Ad Unit page, you can pull the ad unit code by clicking “Code Integration”. Once all your ad units have been created, you can follow our technical guide to begin integration of the SDK.

item.title: Embedded Tweet parameter reference
item.description: An Embedded Tweet supports customization in data-* attributes and JavaScript factory functions. This reference document describes parameters used in all formats. Reference the oEmbed API to set these parameters as part of an HTML response for a Tweet ID or URL. Parameters id required The...

item.title: Create an Ad Unit
item.description: Your application will require one or more Ad Units in order to show ads. From your Inventory tab, click “Add a New App” Select your platform choice in the Device Format section Select Ad Format type...

item.title: Add an Application to the Dashboard
item.description: To target ads to your application, add the application of interest into the MoPub dashboard. From your Inventory tab, click “Add a New App.” Platform: Select the OS you wish your application to target. Options: iOS, Android, Mobile Web...

item.title: Using Rich Media Creative
item.description: To implement a rich media creative, select HTML at the Creative File Type, drop in the HTML rich media tag in the HTML body, and select MRAID ad when applicable. MoPub supports the following rich media vendors: Celtra, Flashtalking, and...

item.title: DFP Integration: Passing Key Values
item.description: Add request parameters in the form $dfp_request_parameter DFP Support Links DFP API Integration Support Link AdMob SDK Support Link Macros are strings of text that the DoubleClick ad server replaces with other strings of text according to a set of rules. Macros are case-sensitive...

item.title: DFP Integration
item.description: App Request URL http://ads.mopub.com/m/ad?v=1&tp=dfpm&mr=1&id= <<INSERT AD UNIT ID>> Mobile Web Request URL http://ads.mopub.com/m/ad?v=1&tp=dfpm&mobile_web=1&id= <<INSERT AD UNIT ID>> Create a MoPub Account...

item.title: Setting Up Ad Network IDs
item.description: Each of the ad networks will provide you a unique ID that you will enter next to your applications when creating a new network order. Below you will find where you can find each of those IDs for AdMob, AdSense, TapIt, InMobi, Jumptap, Millennial Media, Mojiva S2S & MobFox...

item.title: Setting Up Ad Networks
item.description: MoPub supports dozens of the most popular ad networks via server-to-server connections. For a list of standard supported networks, visit here. In addition to these networks, you can set up any network on MoPub via a "Custom Event". These networks are referred to as a "Custom Native Network...

item.title: Twitter Cards
item.description: English | 日本語 Introduction With Twitter Cards, you can attach rich photos, videos and media experience to Tweets that drive traffic to your website. Simply add a few lines of HTML to your webpage, and users who Tweet links to your content will have a "Card" added to the Tweet that’s visible...

item.title: MoPub Ad Formats
item.description: MoPub supports a variety of ad formats for you to monetize your app. When you create an ad unit, you will be asked to select the ad format--Banner, Medium, Fullscreen, Custom, and Native. Native ads offer an opportunity to monetize your app more effectively by matching...

item.title: MoPub Technical Integration
item.description: Here you can find more information on how to work with various networks by creating Custom Event classes. You will also find technical integration and support guides. If you have a specific issue that is not addressed here, please feel free to post a topic in our Discussion Forum.

item.title: MoPub UI
item.description: The MoPub user interface consists of the Dashboard, Inventory, Marketplace, and Networks. The MoPub Dashboard enables you to see your entire monetization strategy on a single screen. The Dashboard offers a single, comprehensive view of all your app revenue data -- including ad networks, MoPub...

item.title: What is MoPub?
item.description: What is MoPub? MoPub is a mobile ad serving platform. We help you monetize your apps more effectively. We offer a free, self-serve product that lets you get started with ad serving quickly while offering sophisticated features that you will need as you grow. With streamlined campaign management,...

item.title: How to Add Users to Your Account
item.description: You can add other users in different roles to your MoPub account and control access to your account. What does this mean? More flexibility with multiple users: Users can use their individual logins to access the same account....

item.title: How to Use the MoPub Dashboard
item.description: How to Use the MoPub Dashboard The MoPub Dashboard enables you to see your entire monetization strategy on a single screen. The Dashboard offers a single, comprehensive view of all your app revenue data -- including ad networks, MoPub Marketplace, and direct campaigns. With the Dashboard...

item.title: MRAID Vendor Tag Certification Process
item.description: MoPub MRAID Vendor Certification Process Guiding Principles: The MoPub SDK is built to be fully compliant with the IAB MRAID v1.0 specification Overview: Pre-Certification Questionnaire Setup Vendor Self Test Vendor impression test Reporting test Scale Test Best Practices...

item.title: Embedded Tweet CMS best practices
item.description: Overview An Embedded Tweets adds pieces of the global conversation happening on Twitter to your site, content, and commentary. Sites powered by a CMS or custom software can provide deeper integration with Twitter content through site-level display preferences, content macros for cross-...
